page.title: 16Beckwithshaw Church 1
page.content: The church was built by Henry and Ellen Williams, local benefactors. The{foundation stone}was laid in Sept 1885 and the church was consecrated in Sept 1886. Built in {local sandstone}from Pot Bank Quarry, as are most of the older buildings. One of the attractive features are the{windows,}all stained glass dedicated to members of the Williams and Dugdale families. The South East window represents St.John viewing Jerusalem. In the other window on the south side,St.John is represented as falling at the feet of the angel on the bank of the River of Life. Each window has two lights and on the North side each light has a separate subject. The first light of the North West window portrays the angel with his right foot on the sea and left on the earth.
